project_abstract.cdata: The project consists of: (i) the establishment of 18 Rural Educational Nuclei consisting of 152 four-grade primary schools, 52 six-grade primary schools and 18 rural community learning centers; 9 agricultural training centers; 4 agricultural secondary schools; and 18 lower secondary schools; (ii) in-service training program for upgrading about 1,000 teachers and 100 administrators for the project institutions; and (iii) technical assistance equivalent to 11 man/years of specialist services and 17 man/years of fellowship for local staff.
